data.text:
SLIGHTLY OFF-TOPIC: I probably won't be able to use Macau as a location now. 👀😬🤷🏻‍♂️😒

⚡️ “Casinos made Macau one of the wealthiest places in the world — but they also brought heightened inequality and crime. Now, China is cracking down.” by @InsiderAsia https://t.co/mcKI141K5F

There will be some who will churlishly state that "The Hustler" is the best poker movie ever made but for me, "Rounders" will always have a place in my heart.

Absolute lightning in a bottle that movies involving poker afterwards have struggled to match.
https://t.co/hAQ8WU9UdL

I feel a mini-series might've been a better treatment for this with some expanded fun setpieces.

You never truly feel for Molly's plight as much as you kinda understand the stakes. 🤷🏻‍♂️

Some cumbersome references (Arthur Miller's "The Crucible"!) make it a little excruciating. 😒

Huh. They went away pretty quickly but went away so quietly that I didn't  hear their van leave. 👀😬🙉😒

Apart from Michael Cera who is substituting for 'you know who', I keep forgetting who the surrogates/alias are really supposed to be.

The reporting around this is more fun.

...back in 2016 to prevent 'sewer flooding', it appears to have been money wasted as I see the drains on my street fill to the brim with rainwater fairly easily.

I'm just keeping an eye on the film & them that nothing untoward is happening.

Aaron's dialogue here is 'creaky'. 😒

Well...it's currently showing on BBC1 so I can't help but refamiliarise myself with it.

Truth be told, I'm a bit on edge as there appears to be a couple of water company workers behind my house working at night (!?) but even after the months of working on sewerage pipe works...

As an OT, I'd love to have a go at remaking "The God of Gamblers".

I think I've got a fresh & interesting take on it to make it a worthwhile endeavour.

Would it be set in Las Vegas!? I think some of it would have to be but there are some obvious other locations if not possible.

Well...am going to guess that Cheung Yin Sun doesn't have a Noo Yawk accent but I may be completely wrong about that.

The focus will be on her & not Phil Ivey? 🤔

"The Baccarat Queen"? Huh. Well at least they're not calling it "The Goddess of Gambling".

https://t.co/3tUQoQSfee

It's not to say I didn't like it but I just felt some scenes could've been punched up & some felt a bit redundant.

It has a feel of "Meanwhile across town from "Rounders"..." about it.

Would've gone for a more usual typical ending ("Molly is now a...") as to what happened here.

Had some time to dwell on it. It's so curious. Jessica's delivery is weirdly monotone or is it me getting deaf (don't ask me if it's Yanni or Laurel...it depends on the pitch & frequency you hear it at!), Sorkin's dialogue isn't as sharp as it can be & it feels 'inconsequential'.

Would say if my project ever gets made (can't see why not...cheap to make, acting showcase for the cast with some dynamite dialogue) that I don't ever need to employ a 'poker consultant' to make my poker scenes realistic.*

* This tweet will NOT come back to haunt me. Oh no, sir.

So...um, I would, arguably needlessly, compare it with "I, Tonya" but Robert McKee already has. May have some words as to what I think.

https://t.co/8mUrT9dx5c

The making of is possibly of more interest from Amy Pascal's hacked messages to "Peppa Pig".

https://t.co/hH3CqSAiJl

Huh. Ragging on "Molly's Game" for its portrayal of high stakes poker!? 

Poker players can be notoriously 'nitpicky' but I can't speak from any experience of playing for 'big money' nor would I want to (low stakes 'tournament poker' is more my thing).

https://t.co/t2csn5V1Ey

Would openly say I've no idea about the legality of playing for money in say, a 'home game' particularly in the USA.

My project? Not about 'The Big Game' or 'high stakes' at all though. #ohnoisaidtoomuch

NOTE TO SELF: Gotta catch a production of "Dealer's Choice" fairly soon.
